trans-unit.source: Provides a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline"></xref> for media content.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> is a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> object which provides control over media timing in the same way that animation timeline objects control animations.

For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> has associated <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.BeginTime%2A> properties can be used to specify when media begins and how long it plays.
See [Animation Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/animation-overview.md) for more information on animation timelines.
There are two ways to associate a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline> to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement> using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline>.

Inside of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Storyboard>, when a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> is targets a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaClock> will be created and assigned to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>â€™s associated player.
See [How to: Control a MediaElement by Using a Storyboard](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/how-to-control-a-mediaelement-by-using-a-storyboard.md) for an example;
By explicitly creating a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaClock> from a <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> and assigning it to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Timeline.Duration%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> is set to `Automatic` (default), the duration of <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline> is the natural duration of the media source.

To find the natural duration of the media source programmatically, query the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement.NaturalDuration%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> that begins at the specified time.
The time to begin the timeline.
Initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> class using the supplied Uri as the media source.
The media source for the timeline.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> that begins at the specified time and lasts for the specified duration.
The time to begin media playback.
The length of time for media playback.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> class that begins at the specified time over the specified time and has the specified repeat behavior.
The time to begin media playback.
The length of time for media playback.
The repeat behavior to use when the playback duration has been reached.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaClock"></xref> for this timeline.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaClock"></xref> for this timeline.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Makes this instance a deep copy of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref>.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> to clone.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Makes this instance a modifiable deep copy of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> using current property values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a modifiable copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValueCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> to clone.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaClock"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref>.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaClock"></xref>.
Creates a new instance of the MediaTimeline.
The new instance.
Makes this instance of MediaTimeline unmodifiable or determines whether it can be made unmodifiable.
`true` to check if the timeline can be frozen; `false` to freeze the timeline.
If isChecking is `true`, this method returns `true` if this can be made unmodifiable, or `false` if it cannot be made unmodifiable.

If isChecking is `false`, this method returns `true` if the specified is now unmodifiable, or `false` if it cannot be made unmodifiable, with the side effect of having made the actual change in frozen status to this object.
Makes this instance a clone of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> object.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

Note that if these properties contain resource references or data bindings, <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> will fail when trying to freeze the object and will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> object to clone and freeze.
Makes this instance a frozen clone of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref>.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method.
To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetCurrentValueAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline"></xref> to copy and freeze.
Retrieves the <xref href="System.Windows.Duration"></xref> from a specified clock.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock"></xref> whose natural duration is desired.
If clock is a , the value of the associated with clock, or if the clock is not a .
Gets or sets the media source associated with the timeline.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The media source associated with the timeline.
The default is **null**.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.MediaTimeline.Source"></xref> dependency property.
Returns the string that represents the media source.
The string that represents the media source.
Gets or sets the base URI of the current application context.
The base URI of the application context.
